description: Expanded Q-A pairs for LDA projection training - UnifyWeaver playbooks (Batch 5)

notes.query_lengths: short (2-4 words), medium (5-15 words), long (15+ words)
notes.answer_variants: Different answer texts per embedding model based on context length

answers.default: JSON to LiteDB Streaming - Stream large JSON datasets into LiteDB using inline C# sources. Demonstrates reading JSON files, parsing with System.Text.Json, and inserting BsonDocuments into LiteDB collections efficiently. Supports querying the populated database via .NET.
answers.all-MiniLM-L6-v2: JSON to LiteDB: Stream JSON data into LiteDB using inline C#. Parses with System.Text.Json and inserts BsonDocuments.
answers.e5-small-v2: JSON to LiteDB Streaming - Efficiently load JSON data into LiteDB using C# inline sources. Parse JSON, create BsonDocuments, and insert into collections.

medium: How to stream JSON into LiteDB?
Use C# to load LiteDB from Prolog
Process large JSON files with LiteDB
long: I want to load a large JSON dataset into a LiteDB database using an efficient streaming approach with C# inline code
How can I use UnifyWeaver to parse JSON files and insert records into a local NoSQL LiteDB database?

answers.default: Tree Recursion - Compile tree-recursive predicates (like tree_sum) that operate on hierarchical data structures. UnifyWeaver transforms recursive logic handling list-represented trees (e.g., [Val, Left, Right]) into executable bash scripts.
answers.all-MiniLM-L6-v2: Tree recursion: Compile predicates for tree structures (tree_sum). Handles hierarchical list data like [Val, L, R].
answers.e5-small-v2: Tree Recursion - Compile tree-recursive predicates. Support for hierarchical data processing and tree traversal algorithms like tree summation.

long: I need to compile a Prolog predicate that recursively traverses a binary tree structure represented as lists
How does UnifyWeaver handle tree recursion where a function calls itself multiple times on branches?

answers.default: C# XML Fragments - Stream and process XML fragments using C# XmlStreamReader. Supports NUL or LF delimited fragments, preserving CDATA, and handling namespaces (including Pearltrees prefixes). Projects elements and attributes into dictionaries.
answers.all-MiniLM-L6-v2: C# XML fragments: Stream XML with XmlStreamReader. Supports NUL/LF delimiters, CDATA, and namespace projection.
answers.e5-small-v2: C# XML Fragments - Process XML data streams. Use XmlStreamReader for fragment parsing, namespace handling, and CDATA preservation.

medium: How to process XML fragments in C#?
long: I want to stream and parse XML fragments separated by newlines using C# integration in UnifyWeaver
How can I process XML data preserving CDATA sections and handling specific namespace prefixes?

answers.default: PowerShell Inline .NET - Embed C# code within PowerShell scripts using Add-Type for high performance (138x speedup with caching). Ideal for automation requiring .NET libraries or tight loops. Supports pre-compilation to cache DLLs and avoid compilation overhead on subsequent runs.
answers.all-MiniLM-L6-v2: PowerShell inline .NET: Embed C# via Add-Type. Enables 138x speedup with DLL caching. access .NET libraries directly.
answers.e5-small-v2: PowerShell Inline .NET - High-performance C# embedding. Use Add-Type with caching for speedups. Integrates .NET libraries into PowerShell workflows.

medium: How to embed C# in PowerShell?
Cache compiled C# DLLs in PowerShell
long: I need to optimize a PowerShell script by embedding performance-critical C# code using Add-Type
How can I compile and cache inline .NET code in PowerShell to achieve faster execution times?

answers.default: Deployment Glue - Manage service deployment via SSH, Docker, Kubernetes, and Cloud Functions. Declare services and deployment methods (ssh, docker, k8s) in Prolog. Generates deployment scripts and manifests for lifecycle management.
answers.all-MiniLM-L6-v2: Deployment glue: Deploy services via SSH, Docker, K8s. Generate scripts/manifests from Prolog declarations.
answers.e5-small-v2: Deployment Glue - Service deployment automation. Support for SSH, Docker, Kubernetes, and Cloud Functions. Generate infrastructure code.

medium: How to deploy services with UnifyWeaver?
Deploy via SSH using deployment glue
long: I want to automate service deployment to remote servers via SSH or generate Docker Compose files
How can I declare service configurations and generate deployment scripts for Kubernetes or Cloud Functions?
